text: You can implement the training phase of a naive Bayes classifier in this setup in O(ked + nd), since you only need to do a constant amount of work for each z;; value; usually ke < n and so this is O(nd). (You do not have to actually implement it in this way for the previous question, but you should think about how this could be done.) What is the cost of classifying ¢ test examples with the model and this way of computing the predictions? It’s preferable to leave your answer in terms of k and c if relevant.
